results.title: Africa dances
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Ben Park, George Movshon and Ramakantha Sarma
results.brief_description: Presents the performance given by Les Ballets Africains in the General Assembly Hall of the United Nations Headquarters on the anniversary of the adoption by the UN of the Human Rights declaration. The vivacity of this authentic dance group is complemented by accompanying instruments. With an introduction by H. E. M. Achkar Marof, ambassador from Guinea to the UN, translated by Alistair Cooke.

results.title: Africa awakens modern Nigeria
results.creator_credit: Atlantis Productions and J. Michael Hagopian
results.brief_description: Presents Nigeria, the most populated country in Africa progressing in the use of modern techniques and self-government. Stresses the influences of climate and geography on the economy, urbanization and education. Shows how the country has developed from a rich and ancient civilization, to becoming an independent nation.

results.title: Africa alive
results.brief_description: Africa is a continent of mystery and beauty known for the splendour and grandeur of its wildlife which is under threat by poachers decimating the continent’s elephant and rhinoceros populations. “Africa Alive” reveals modern Africa in all its guises; its timeless beauty and its many characters. The expedition travels coastal Africa in a traditional vessel to capture the the soul and spirit of this distinctive land.

results.title: Africa : village on stilts
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, UNICEF and Denis Hargrave
results.brief_description: Depicts the tribal traditions in a typical fishing village in the Republic of Dahomey, Africa, where the houses are built high on stilts above the water. Features Nicolas an 11 year old boy, as he goes to school, swims, plays and helps his father. Also shows how the piping in of clean drinking water helped reduce the death rate from cholera and other water-borne diseases. Narrated by Percy Rodriguez.

results.title: Africa's elephant kingdom
results.brief_description: Wide and high above Africa, the camera travels over waterfalls, rivers, plains and forests. Large groups of elephants move purposefully across the plains. One comes closer. He is the Old Bull, our storyteller, and it is through his eyes that we visit Africa’s Elephant Kingdom. This is the story of one such clan and their journey across vast stretches of land in search of dwindling sources of food and water, and how they emerge triumphant in one glorious moment when the long awaited rains finally arrive. This film was originally produced for Imax giant screen presentation by an all Australian team headed by Producer, Writer and Director Michael Caulfield, and Scientific Consultant Iain Douglas-Hamilton. Narrated by Avery Brooks. Includes the making of ‘Africa’s Elephant Kingdom’.

results.title: Afraid of school: a case of school phobia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Tommy, aged six, refuses to go to school and is obsessed with thoughts of death and dying. After bribery, persuasion and spanking, his desperate parents seek psychiatric help at a children’s hospital. Both Tommy and his parents receive counselling, and learn to come to grips with his going to school. Psychiatrist: Taylor Statten, MD.

results.title: Afraid of school
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Psychiatrist Dr. Taylor discusses Tommy, a six year old boy who is afraid of attending school. Interviews with Tommy and his parents eventually reveal the cause and help Tommy overcome his fear.

results.title: AFL: I'd like to see that [advertisement] 1996
results.brief_description: Produced in 1996 to commemorate the Centenary of Australian Rules Football this ad features international celebrities John Lee Hooker (musician), Heather Locklear (actress), Archbishop Desmond Tutu (religious leader) and George Burns (comedian). Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: AFL: I'd like to see that [advertisement] 1994
results.brief_description: Produced in 1994 to promote Australian Rules Football as a national game, this ad features international sportspeople Evander Holyfeld (boxer), Hakeem ‘The Dream’ Olajuwon (basketball player), Carl Lewis (runner), Sharron Davies (swimmer), John McEnroe (tennis player), Dean Richards (rugby player) and Ian Wright (soccer player). Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Afghanistan: threads of life
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Irwin Dermer
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of aspects of the way of life in Afghanistan. Shows the age old methods of making grape juice, rug making, baking, and salt grinding. Also shows the lifestyle of the camel traders and the atmosphere of the bazaars where the rug and carpet makers go to find the best possible price for their wares.
